speaker: MAN
line: Hello.

speaker: GARY
line: Hello. May I speak to Mr. Zachary Llosa?

speaker: LLOSA
line: Yo-sa, not Losa. Speaking.

speaker: GARY
line: Hello, Mr. Llosa. I’m calling on behalf of the VinylRight corporation which would like to put

speaker: LLOSA
line: I’m not really interested at this time.

speaker: GARY
line: Yes, sir. $100 all for allowing us the privilege of introducing you to VinylRight siding, The thousand-year siding that never needs painting or maintenance.

speaker: LLOSA
line: Listen, I’m not really interested.

speaker: GARY
line: Manufactured in America from Space-Age polymers it beautifies while it protects, while it adds to the resale value of your home.

speaker: LLOSA
line: Look, I’m not interested. I have to go now. Sorry. I have to go.

speaker: SUPERVISOR
line: Yo, Gary. Dial and smile, Gary. See, if you’re not smiling, they can hear it.

speaker: NANCY
line: If you’re not smiling, they can hear it. Jerk. Yes, Mr. Valenzuela. I’m calling on behalf of the VinylRight Coporation. evening ….

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Hello?

speaker: GARY
line: Mrs. Edith Loach?

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Yes, that’s me.

speaker: GARY
line: Hello, Mrs. Loach. I’m calling on behalf of the VinylRight Corporation which would like to

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: You want to give me $100? Why?

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Hello? Did I win something?

speaker: GARY
line: Yes, Ma’am. $100… All for allowing us the privilege of introducing you to VinylRight siding, the thousand-year siding that never needs painting or maintenance. Manufactured in America from…

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Hello?

speaker: GARY
line: Manufactured in America from Space-Age polymers. It beautifies while it protects. While it … While it….

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Hello? Hello?

speaker: GARY
line: Mrs. Loach .. listen very carefully. It’s here.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Sir, Agents Mulder and Scully are here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Send them in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agents have a seat.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need you to go to Chicago as soon as possible to perform a threat assessment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A threat assessment for whom?

speaker: SKINNER
line: VinylRight. They make siding. Their telemarketing hub in Oakbrook was the focus of an anonymous audio-taped manifesto, one which threatened violence. Apparently, several years back they had an incident in another office – A disgruntled employee with a gun. They feel they can’t be too careful.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why can’t the Chicago field office take care of it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Because I prefer you did.

speaker: MULDER
line: Because the manifesto contains bizarre overtones … claims of a paranormal nature?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It speaks of a monster stalking employees. Your insight into such claims should aid in assessing the threat, if any, posed by this person.

speaker: MULDER
line: Monsters. I’m your boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: I must’ve done something to piss him off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Get stuck with this jerk-off assignment or have I finally reached that magic point in my career where every time somebody sees Bigfoot or the Virgin Mary on a tortilla I get called to offer my special insight on the matter?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re saying "I" a lot. I heard "we." Nor do I assume that this case is just a waste of our time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not yours, anyway. There’s no reason both of us should go to Chicago. I’ll take care of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m monster boy, right?

speaker: PINCUS
line: This was forwarded to us by a local radio station. Whoever sent it to them wanted them to play it over and over again 24 hours a day. They elected not to.

speaker: GARY’S VOICE ON TAPE
line: Attention, people of Illinois. This is a warning of the utmost urgency. At VinylRight 12340 Wabash Terrace in Oak Brook there is a monster, an evil one that preys on the people there, but they can’t see it because it hides in the light. I see it. I know where to look. I can’t be the only one. We all must hunt it down and kill it because if we don’t … it will take us all.

speaker: MULDER
line: You recognize the voice?

speaker: PINCUS
line: We have 96 employees. Anyway, I’m hoping it’s not one of our people though I don’t know who else it would be.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your company had a violent incident in its recent history?

speaker: PINCUS
line: We have a plant in Kansas City. Back in ’94 one of the warehouse guys came in with a gun, threatened everybody. I think it was over a woman.

speaker: MULDER
line: May I borrow the tape?

speaker: PINCUS
line: Keep it. So I know our home office has to call you guys for insurance reasons, but this is probably just a crank, right? Some guy making a joke.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it’s best to err on the side of caution. Can you hire security for the building?

speaker: PINCUS
line: If you think we need to. I’m also conducting my own internal investigation – interviewing employees, seeing if they’re happy …

speaker: MULDER
line: Use you best judgement. I’ll be in touch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi. It’s me. I need you to check on something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s a phrase, "Hiding in the light." It’s on this tape that I’m looking into.

speaker: SCULLY
line: On the case that’s a total waste of time?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, and I didn’t say that it wasn’t. Uh, "To hide in the light" or "Hiding in the light" – some form of that. I think it’s in an old case file somewhere that I got hidden away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which one? There’s hundreds.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not sure, but I appreciate it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Hiding in the light."

speaker: PINCUS
line: Nancy Aaronson, come to my office, please.

speaker: NANCY
line: Uh-oh. Now I did it.

speaker: GARY
line: Nancy …

speaker: NANCY
line: Yeah?

speaker: PINCUS
line: Nancy Aaronson, come to my office, please.

speaker: NANCY
line: What, Gary?

speaker: GARY
line: Don’t.

speaker: NANCY
line: Don’t what? Gary, I love you, buddy, but you’re really, really weird.

speaker: SUPERVISOR
line: Dial and smile, Gary.

speaker: PINCUS
line: Mark Backus, come to my office, please. Mark Backus, come to my office, please.

speaker: NANCY
line: See, nothing to it. He just wants to say "hi" to everybody. He’s going alphabetically.

speaker: SUPERVISOR
line: Hey, Gary. Gary Lambert!

speaker: GARY’S VOICE ON TAPE
line: ….Wabash Terrace in Oakbrook, there is a monster .. an evil one that preys on the people there but they can’t see it because it hides in the light. I see it. I know where to look. I can’t be the only one. … urgency. At VinylRight, 12340 Wabash Terrace in Oakbrook, there is a monster .. an evil one that preys on the people there but they can’t see it because it hides in the light. I see it. I know where to look. I can’t be the only one. We all must hunt it down and kill it because if we don’t … it will take us all.

speaker: (MULDER’S NOTES
line: "… to be taken seriously. Exactness of performance indicates deliberate mindset. Tape likely recorded many times till perfect. Paranoia. Exclusion.")

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Hiding in the light." That was a phrase spoken by one Jerrold Resnick to a Lakeland, Florida police investigator on August 9, 1992.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was he describing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Mr. Resnick was a deacon of his local church and apparently he was concerned that there was an evil presence amongst his fellow parishioners and that he alone was aware of that fact.

speaker: MULDER
line: He was trying to warn them?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not as such. He showed up for mass one Sunday with four handguns and he began wounding people saying, "The afflicted ones wouldn’t bleed." He committed suicide a week later in his cell.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, at the risk of you telling me "I told you so" I think it’s time for you to get down here and help me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told you so.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello .. hello?

speaker: NANCY
line: Shh! Get down! Get down!

speaker: GARY
line: Who are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who’s the agent in charge?

speaker: AGENT
line: Agent Rice --- tall guy in the suit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m Scully. Agent Mulder’s partner. What can you tell me?

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Not much. TV news got the call. A man’s voice told them we needed to broadcast a "stunning revelation." Since then we keep ringing the phones, but nobody answers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who’s inside?

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: We can’t be sure of a total. It happened over lunch hour, so it could have been worse. The lot’s only got 18 cars. One’s a rental registered to Agent Mulder.

speaker: SWAT AGENT
line: We’re about to try him on his cell phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Not until we get a clear idea of the situation.

speaker: SWAT AGENT
line: There’s a small cafeteria in the building. We think our guy’s got everyone barricaded there, he couldn’t have picked a better spot – one door, no windows. We’re not going to get a clear idea of the situation unless someone in there talks to us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you make a phone call right now, it could compromise Agent Mulder. Sir, we need to find another way.

speaker: GARY
line: Move! Okay … come on. Now, get down. Down. Everybody stop crying! Just shut up! Everybody needs to be afraid of him. He’s the one that’s out to get you. I’m protecting you.

speaker: NANCY
line: Gary, what are you talking about?

speaker: GARY
line: Shut up! I’m not addressing you! I’m addressing the actual people over here, okay? I’m not talking to you, or you or you!

speaker: MULDER
line: Why should we be afraid of Mr. Pincus, Gary? I’d really like to hear what you have to say.

speaker: GARY
line: Who are you, anyway?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name is Mulder.

speaker: GARY
line: You said that already. What are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Applying for a job.

speaker: GARY
line: Oh, man … did you come to the wrong place.

speaker: MULDER
line: I get that. Why should we be afraid of Mr. Pincus, Gary?

speaker: GARY
line: Because he’s a monster … Only you can’t see that because he’s clouded all your minds but he means to take us all one by one … harvest our souls …

speaker: GARY
line: …make us into zombies… robots made out of meat.

speaker: PINCUS
line: Oh, God almighty …

speaker: MULDER
line: Gary, I want to believe that you’re protecting us, but, uh, I’m kind of afraid of that rifle. It makes it hard for us actual people to concentrate on what you’re saying.

speaker: GARY
line: Why are you talking to me like I’m a three-year-old? Don’t act like you understand what I’m talking about, because you don’t … but you will.

speaker: GARY
line: Shhh! Everybody hold their breath. Oh, you sons of bitches.

speaker: NANCY
line: Gary, what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Gary!

speaker: SWAT AGENT
line: Everybody hold your fire! What’s going on?

speaker: AGENT ON RADIO
line: He’s shooting the ceiling. Sounds like an AK.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: We got to find out what the hell’s going on in that building. I’m calling your partner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. If it was safe to do so he would have called us already.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Agent Scully, we don’t have a lot of options here.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s just my cell phone. Let me get it.

speaker: GARY
line: Put your hands behind your head.

speaker: GARY
line: FBI? You happy now? You want to mess with me some more?

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Hello. Is anybody on the line? We heard gunfire. Is everyone all right?

speaker: GARY
line: I just shot a zombie. Everybody thinks I killed him, but I didn’t.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Who am I speaking to?

speaker: GARY
line: The guy that’s going to start killing actual people if you don’t put me on the damn TV!

speaker: OUTSIDE
line: nan

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: I think he just shot a hostage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: He’s still asking for his 15 minutes of fame.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give it to him.

speaker: INSIDE
line: nan

speaker: GARY
line: Get it out of sight. You want to know why it jumped me like that?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s not an it, Gary. It’s a he. It’s a man you just killed. What was his name?

speaker: MAN
line: Mark Backus.

speaker: GARY
line: Wrong! It stopped being Mark Backus when he turned it into a zombie … … and then he instructed it by means of mental telepathy to attack me … and so I shot it. I had no choice .. but it doesn’t matter because it was already dead. He wants us all like that – insects, not people .. mindless drones. He wants to take away who we are … to control us … so we’ll be his eyes and ears and spy on each other and help him do his dirty work.

speaker: PINCUS
line: Gary, if I’m the monster, what do you need all these people for? Why don’t you just let them all go?

speaker: GARY
line: You just wait till I put you on TV. Then they’ll see what you are.

speaker: MULDER
line: Answer the phone, Gary.

speaker: GARY
line: Dial and smile.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Okay. We’re sending you that cameraman -- Now just stay cool.

speaker: GARY
line: Finally. Let’s do it.

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: Warren, that is exactly what we’re hearing.

speaker: GARY
line: All you people put your butts against the door. Hurry it up! Go!

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: …. Going on here at Oak Brook Corporate …

speaker: GARY
line: You, get over by the counter. Move it!

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: … to an actual live feed from the ….

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: ….. that this person or people may have something important to say.

speaker: GARY
line: You see who’s going to get hurt if you bust down this door?

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: …. communication between the police and the people inside the building.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he getting this?

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Closed circuit’s bouncing it back into the building. He thinks he’s going to be a star. All right. Show us the room.

speaker: GARY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: CAMERAMAN
line: Hold on, my battery cable is twisted.

speaker: GARY
line: Well untwist it!

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: As to whether anybody was injured

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: There. The exterior wall is clear. Entry team into position.

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: It sounded rapid – very rapid bursts. What we do know, however is that the police and the swat team on hand…

speaker: GARY
line: Lie down on the floor. Do it.

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: …did not return fire. Warren, I’m getting a signal that the cameraman is in place …

speaker: GARY
line: All right. Put me on.

speaker: FAKE ANCHORWOMAN
line: … and we’re about to switch to our live feed inside … Yes here it is. Here we go.

speaker: GARY
line: People of America … A monster walks among you. Go. Pan over. Get up.

speaker: GARY
line: Now, I’ll show it to you .

speaker: MULDER
line: No, Gary.

speaker: GARY
line: Get out of the way.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don’t do this.

speaker: GARY
line: Get out of the way!

speaker: MULDER
line: Don’t do this, Gary.

speaker: GARY
line: Get out of the way!

speaker: MULDER
line: Put down the rifle.

speaker: GARY
line: Get out of the way, now!

speaker: GARY
line: There. Look at it. Look at it!

speaker: GARY
line: See?

speaker: GARY
line: Now, you know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You look exhausted.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I’m fine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Rice has the situation in hand. Let’s get you out of here. Mulder?

speaker: PINCUS
line: I can’t begin to thank you. I owe you my life. We all do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have any idea why he fixated on you the way he did?

speaker: PINCUS
line: No, not at all. I feel like I barely even know the man. I mean, I try to be a good guy to work for.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mentioned another incident with another employee at a plant in Kansas City in 1994.

speaker: PINCUS
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were you at that plant at that time?

speaker: PINCUS
line: Well, I wasn’t there when it happened, but yeah. Did I mention that?

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Lakeland, Florida. Have you ever lived there?

speaker: PINCUS
line: I’ve been there. I have relatives there. Was there anything else?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, no, Mr. Pincus. Thank you very much for your patience.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, why didn’t you take the day off?

speaker: MULDER
line: Close the door. There was a reason the phrase "hiding in the light" seemed so familiar to me. I found it or variations of it in five other X-Files. "Hiding in plain view" "Hiding in the open" "Lurking in the open." All to describe some sort of manifestation of evil which goes unnoticed be everyone except the claimant in each case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you slept?

speaker: MULDER
line: Seven cities in all dating back ten years. VinylRight has offices within 50 miles of 4 of those cities. Greg Pincus has worked for VinylRight for ten years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly is it you think you have here?

speaker: MULDER
line: What if Gary Lambert was right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you’re not serious.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just bear with me for a moment. What if such a creature existed that could camouflage itself by clouding the minds of its victims? There are antecedents for it in nature. In the insect world, mantids are said to hypnotize their prey.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if it could induce a visual hallucination – a sort of temporary conversion disorder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what you’re describing would be more like some kind of a visual agnosia, an inability to recognize what’s before one’s eyes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Only Gary Lambert could see through it somehow, as could the others – maybe because of some heightened adrenaline level of maybe just because he knew where to look somehow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he was disturbed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but did he see it because he was disturbed, or was he disturbed because he saw it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was mentally ill. This monster was a sick fantasy … a product of his dementia.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw it, too. Does that make me disturbed? Demented? Does that make me sick, too?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No, I mean, this … this kind of thing is not uncommon. You … you went through a terrible ordeal and sometimes people in close associations under tense conditions, the delusions of one can be passed on to the other.

speaker: MULDER
line: Folie A Deux? It’s not that, Scully. It’s not Helsinki Syndrome either. What I saw was real, and there may be a way to prove it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: Lambert pointed out certain individuals he said had been victimized by Pincus, turned into zombies. The man he shot, Backus was one of them. If you would autopsy the body …

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No, absolutely not.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, if this is all in my mind I would be very grateful if you would prove that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I am not going to serve the delusions of Gary Lambert, a madman, by giving credence to them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then I’ll prove it without you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: So, what are we looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ll know it when I see it.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: What’s this about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Lambert was tracking his boss’s movements over the years.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Stalking him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gathering evidence.

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you see her? You see where she went?

speaker: AGENT RICE
line: Who? You mind telling me what’s going on here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir? You wanted to see me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes. I was hoping you could give me some insight into Agent Mulder’s recent behavior.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why is he back in Illinois? I thought that case was closed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder believes that there may be a connection between the Oak Brook incident and several other cases.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But you elected not to join him. The Chicago field office has been in contact with him. They describe his behavior as being erratic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: To the best of my knowledge, Agent Mulder is currently working on a legitimate investigation. I will join him in Illinois immediately.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don’t you have an autopsy to do first? This body Mulder sent to Quantico … Mark Backus, the shooting victim. You’re scheduled to do an examination. Or didn’t you know that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ll get right on it, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I there something you want to tell me, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let’s start with the photos. In fact, let’s just do photos. External exam only.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: This guy came a long way just to have his picture taken.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Knock yourself out.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: Case number 98-6522, Mark Backus 45-year-old Caucasian male. There are three one centimeter gunshot entry wounds on the left anterior chest wall with some burn stippling present.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, Mulder.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: Judging from the corpse’s resolved rigor and fixed lividity as well as the decompositional bloating I’d place the time of death between 48 and 72 hours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. This man died late yesterday afternoon.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: Are you sure?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Absolutely.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: Sure looks to me like he’s been dead longer than that.

speaker: GRETCHEN
line: Suddenly, I became aware of this … this presence … and I could feel it creeping toward me. It was terrifying. And the next thing I knew… … this madman’s inside my house. He breaks my window, kicks in the door and the whole time, he’s screaming about monsters -- I mean even worse than Gary.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Miss Starns, I apologize for this incident. I assure you it will receive my utmost attention.

speaker: PINCUS
line: Why don’t you take the rest of the week, Gretchen?

speaker: GRETCHEN
line: Thank you, Mr. Pincus. That man has no business carrying a gun, you ask me.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got to her, too, didn’t you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder …

speaker: MULDER
line: I was too late. You changed her somehow. You infected her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, think very carefully about the next words that come out of your mouth. Once again, I apologize.

speaker: PINCUS
line: There’s no need. I’m well aware of the stress Agent Mulder has been under and I’m, uh, well, I still consider him a hero which is why I want to handle this privately.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We appreciate that.

speaker: PINCUS
line: For my part I’m happy to let this entire matter drop. I’m sure I can persuade Miss Starns to do the same, provided Agent Mulder is amenable.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t see what’s going on here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I’m afraid I do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lambert knew your secret. He knew you were sucking the humanity out of these people, feeding on them!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, that’s enough! I don’t want to hear another word out of you. If you care about your career, you’ll knock this crap off and apologize to this man because I will not …

speaker: MULDER
line: Get out of the way!

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at it!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Stop!

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at it! Look at it!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Relax! Stop struggling! Stop it!

speaker: MULDER
line: Five years together, Scully. You must have seen this coming. Did you examine Backus’ body? What did you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: More or less what we thought we’d find.

speaker: MULDER
line: "More or less?" What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The body showed signs of decomposition beyond what we expected to find which, in and of itself means nothing, really. Time of death is notoriously hard to quantify.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or, that Lambert was telling the truth and that man was dead before he was gunned down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, Mulder…

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully .. When that monster, Pincus – whatever the hell you want to call it – when he attacked that woman last night he did something to the back of her neck. H-he bit her there, or he injected something in there. There’s got to be evidence of that. You got to check for that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the case is over. There’s no more evidence to be gathered. There’s only my hope that you’ll be able to see past this delusion.

speaker: MULDER
line: *You* have to be willing to see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wish it were that simple.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you *have* to believe me. Nobody else on this whole damn planet does or ever will. You’re my one in … five billion.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: Well, you just made it. I was about to ship him. Full autopsy this time?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Let’s flip him.

speaker: LAB GUY
line: Flip him over?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yep. Give me a hand.

speaker: MULDER
line: We can do without these, huh? What do you say?

speaker: NURSE
line: Sorry.

speaker: NURSE
line: There we go. Sleep tight. Don’t let the bed bugs bite.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nurse. Nurse! Nurse! It’s here! Nurse! It’s here! It’s here! It’s at the window!

speaker: NURSE
line: What’s here?

speaker: MULDER
line: There is something … there is something at the window and it’s trying to get in here. Please unstrap me so that I can stop it.

speaker: NURSE
line: We’re three floors up. There’s nothing at the window.

speaker: MULDER
line: Undo my straps so I can check.

speaker: NURSE
line: I can show you …

speaker: MULDER
line: No, don’t! No! Just please …! Please.

speaker: NURSE
line: See? Nothing’s going to get you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. Just, uh … just untie me anyway please.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing?

speaker: NURSE
line: You just need some fresh air.

speaker: NURSE
line: I can’t be running in here all night, okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Help! Somebody help!

speaker: NURSE
line: I’m very sorry, but it is after hours and Mr. Mulder is resting. I’ll have to ask you to come back in the morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve come a long way, and I know he wants to see me, so what do you say?

speaker: NURSE
line: I’m sorry. Really. It’s hospital policy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Help! Help! Help!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, I have to say I’m at a bit of a loss here. Do I infer correctly from this that you believe there’s some … merit to Agent Mulder’s claims?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe that Agent Mulder is mentally sound and fit for duty. Aside from that belief, I can only present to you the few hard facts that I’ve been able to gather. That, as per Agent Mulder’s assertions a toxin has been found to have been injected into the spine of the shooting victim, Mark Backus. As of yet, we’ve been unable to identify it. Furthermore, Gregory Pincus has apparently disappeared without a trace along with half a dozen other key witnesses integral to this investigation – among them, Agent Mulder’s nurse at the hospital and several VinylRight employees.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Men and women described by Mulder as zombies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can personally vouch for the fact that there was an intruder in Agent Mulder’s hospital room.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Describe this intruder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was dark.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You must have gotten a glimpse. What did you see?

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you tell him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The truth … as well as I under stand it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Folie A Deux. A madness shared by two.

speaker: YOUNG EMPLOYEE
line: Mr. Jaycox, may I take a few moments to tell you about the advantages of WeatherRight replacement windows? They keep down high heating and cooling costs. They beautify … They beautify and add value to your home as well as …. Mr. Jaycox … It’s here!
